intro: Gnidia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf gnidia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, narrow leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that are often followed by small, winged fruits. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Gnidia stenophylla is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
